CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Impartial tribunal);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
JUDGES: Jon Fridrik Kjølbro;Julia Laffranque;Nebojša Vučinić;Stéphanie Mourou-Vikström;Ksenija Turković
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Sinj .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON brought a civil action against the applicant before ORG ( PERSON ) , seeking that a will be declared null and void . ORG was represented by lawyers , PERSON . and GPE
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adopted a judgment in the applicant ’s favour .

CARDINAL . The plaintiff lodged an appeal with ORG ( PERSON ) . ORG of that ORG has over forty judges . On DATE a panel of CARDINAL judges presided over by Judge PERSON , sitting in a closed meeting , reversed the first - instance judgment and upheld the appeal . It held that the first - instance court had correctly established the facts but had wrongly applied the relevant law .

CARDINAL . The applicant lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG ( PERSON ) alleging , inter alia , that she had not had a fair hearing before an independent and impartial tribunal because Judge PERSON was the father of a trainee lawyer working at the law office of GPE . and GPE , who had both represented the plaintiff in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law as unfounded and upheld the second - instance judgment . It held in particular :

“ The case file shows that ORG , Judge PERSON ’s son , did not participate in any manner in the proceedings at issue . This court therefore considers that there are no circumstances which put the impartiality of Judge PERSON in such doubt as to exclude his participation in the adoption of the appeal judgment . ”

CARDINAL . In a constitutional complaint of CARDINAL DATE the applicant argued that even though ORG had not participated at the hearings held in the proceedings at issue , there were no indications that he had not been otherwise involved in the case . He had been in a relationship of subordination ( employer - employee ) to the opposing party ’s legal representative and the law office concerned had employed only a very small number of people . The applicant noted that the first - instance judgment in her favour had also later been reversed on appeal . The constitutional complaint was declared inadmissible on DATE by ORG .
